Description: A rayon cloth with magenta, white and black warps and occasional weft stripes of white and gold. Two large sections, predominantly magenta in colour, display triangular, tapestry-woven patterns in black and white.
Curator's comments: Such cloth is woven in a continuous strip, divided at regular intervals by a section from which the weft elements have been omitted. Individual textiles, with fringes at each end, are produced by cutting the cloth at these points. This example shows two textiles still joined in this way. See C.J.Spring and J.M.Hudson "North African Textiles" (BMP,London,1995) for the history of this type of textile.
